COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS  2016  – Telling Stories of Resistance, Fossil Fuel Divestment Student Network Zine 2015 – Tufts Public Art Flash Collective, Museum Without Walls, Medford, MA (with Avram Finklestein of Gran Fury; Funded by the Massachusetts Cultural Council) Breakthrough, Tufts Undergraduate Science Magazine (Volume V, Issue III), Medford, MA Breakthrough, Tufts Undergraduate Science Magazine (Volume V, Issue II), Medford, MA 2014 – Artistry Magazine (Northeastern University), Boston, MA

workExperience.jobTitle: Experiment in Art Science Engagement (EASE) Artist-in-Residence

responsibilities: • Worked one on one with students to assist them with developing project ideas and with improving technical skills.

• Researched scholarship and exhibition opportunities alongside the supervising teacher to coordinate student participation.

workExperience.organization: School of the Museum of Fine Arts, Tufts University

responsibilities: • Designed and conducted public guided tours, gallery talks, art-making workshops, and family programs to acquaint individuals with M.I.T.’s exhibition-related events and public artwork.
• Worked alongside PR/Marketing/Social Media/ and Curatorial departments; planned and prepared advertising and promotional material for distribution.

• Utilized a donor centric approach to efficiently and effectively communicate the goals and objectives of the university to Alumni and Donors, in order to meet the philanthropic goals in terms of annual contacts, pledges, and financial support.

President's Working Group on Racism and Bias
Tufts University Art Gallery and the Tisch College of Citizenship and Public Service at Tufts hosted a public
art project for the Tufts' Medford campus, informed by the themes of the "Race, Inequality, and Action"
forum organized by the Provost's Office.
The project was led by New York-based activist artist Avram Finkelstein, who is best known for his work
with the artist's collective Gran Fury during the 1980s-90s AIDS epidemic in the U.S.
The money gained from personal and individual visual art commissions go abroad; so far the money has
helped rebuild a church and shelter in the Philippines after Typhoon Haiyan.
